metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10720 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of GRO in versions before 5.2. This flaw allows an attacker with local access to crash the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.3.0-1016-aws - 5.3.0-1016.17~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
